title: Runaan's Hurricane
body: Built commonly on a whole 1 champion. Built rarely on 2-3 others. A bad item on most ADCs. For an item with such an interesting passive, it sucks that it doesn't see nearly any usage. It would be nice if this item got a buff. This is a fun item to use, but is really only good on Kalista as she scales well AS and the item procs Rend. You really can't use it on anyone else without feeling bad that you're wasting 2500 gold and an item slot. This item even got a small buff in 5.8, but it's still useless on most champions. Can we make it more than a way for lazy ADCs to waveclear better?

This guy hit the nail on the head.

Hurricane was meant for applying on hit effects, so any ADC with an on-hit effect could consider it.

The biggest issues are:

1.  Not all the ADCs have an on hit effect by themselves
2.  Not a lot of items apply an on hit effect ADCs want.  I mean an ADC could get ER but they don't.
3.  The more on hit effects and AD you have, the better it is.  Sadly, 1 and 2 hurt here.
4.  Side bolts don't apply crits (or let you stack vayne's silver bolts on multiple enemies)
5.  ADCs have a lot of things they need to buy and not much room for anything else.
6.  If you fall behind and need to wave clear at your base, you probably don't have the AD to clear fast enough.  Thus you can't pick this up when behind.
7.  AS by itself is a pretty meh stat to have.  Some ADCs scale better off of AD or Crit.
8.  Going back to 2, if this item had some form of nice on hit itself, it'd be better.  If the side bolts had a .6 or .7 AD scaling, it'd be better.
9.  Because it isn't a high priority on many champs, the game might end before you can buy it.

I like this item and I use it from time to time, but I understand it has issues.  TBH my favorite user of this is {{champion:61}} with nashors as a 4th or 5th item.

Well, you don't just auto attack, you weave AAs between spells on her.  However her ult pulls multiple champs together which makes Hurricane a little better.  

That's another thing about hurricane.  If you are attacking 3 enemy champs, it gives you more damage than IE.  However against 1, it'd kind of weak.  So while you might want to pick it up for wave clear, when you are in PvP, hitting multiple enemy champs means you might be out of position most of the time.  1 enemy champ plus 2 minions ain't so bad though.

Pretty much spot on. But in general its in a good spot right now. I usually build botrk and Hurricane on Thresh because Hurricane procs his E to deal surprisingly a lot of damage.

But if Hurricane is able to proc crits then it would be absolutely OP. Think about champs like Jinx where she can just use rockets and those rockets can crit.
Ashe crits. Ashe crits on everything.

What do you think of these things that might help?
1. As you said, increase the ad scaling of side bolts.
2. Have the side bolts be able to crit, but only for either 50, 75 or 100% of the crit damage.
3. Also as you said, could give it an on-hit effect as well, maybe like an armor reducing effect similar to wit's end.
4. It could always have other things that help it, like maybe a slow on all 3 bolts or maybe like a 20-25% slow on bolts that crit idk something random like that.

I think small additional AD scaling could help.  Crits might work, but it'd probably have to be for a flat amount like 25-50 damage.

A good on-hit effect for it is an issue though.  Teemo gets it.  Kayle gets it.  Kalista gets it.  It's got to be something both AP and AD ranged attackers would like.  

I'd love to see splash damage like Kayle's E but that's a bit too much.  A small slow might work simply because ranged champs don't get frozen mallet on one hand, on the other you'd have to consider them kiting.  Thematically, a slow sounds best but I can't say if it'd work well from a balance standpoint.  Maybe something that lets you steal AS and MS for 2-3 seconds would be cool if the slow route is viable.  A small on hit true damage (10-20) might work.  A small on hit heal/mana recovery feature might work.  An on-hit CDR effect would be interesting to see.

A good bit more than one champion uses it. It's a very build focused item more than champion focused. Which is how a gimmick item should be. 

It's not common because on hit builds are generally strong on melee champions more than ranged unless they have something to make it worth a lot of attack speed over more power. Generally stronger single target damage is better than being able to hit multiple targets.

The thing is, with the exception of Kalista and maybe Kayle (I don't play her often), none of them even build it 50% of the time. Most of the characters up there are either not in the meta, or not in the meta with a Hurricane build. Kog and Varus are meta-ish, but both are more for poke as midlaners. Kog and Varus and Ashe and especially Twitch are all meh ADCs at best.

A lot of those builds wouldn't even be possible without Hurricane. 

Niche items that get reworked/removed often are done so because their loss has no impact on the game. 

Losing Hurricane would likely mean Kalista/Kayle buffs. Maybe Twitch. 
AA Teemo would die and he'd only bee shroom or burst Teemo. 
AP Varus would be hurt quite badly. It's already gimmicky. May as well remove his AP ratio's if they delete Hurricane. 
Ashe is just pain gimmicky. Losing it wouldn't really hurt her at all. 

Zeke's getting reworked didn't require a buffing/nerfing process because it's core on no one. Same with Atma's getting deleted.
Runaan's is fine. The issue is most champions don't want AOE damage. You want single target damage AKA crit. The exceptions happen because the item breaks the champion.
